revised_title: Musical Duodenes and the Theory of Constructing Instruments with Fixed Tones in Just Intonation
tldr: The author, Alexander J. Ellis, presents a theory of constructing musical instruments with fixed tones in just or practically just intonation using the concept of musical duodenes. He also introduces a new theory of harmonic scales and modulation and discusses various temperaments and their applications in music. The author believes that his theory can help improve the intonation of musical instruments without requiring changes in fingering or mechanism.
